snippet: Today's Internet is a place for getting things done, pushing aside the cyberflâneur - the heir to the flâneur culture of 19th-century France.
abstract: Today's Internet is a place for getting things done, pushing aside the cyberflâneur - the heir to the flâneur culture of 19th-century France.
lead_paragraph: The flâneur would leisurely stroll through Paris streets and especially its arcades. Cyberflâneurs, however, are few and far between, while the very practice of cyberflânerie seems at odds with the world of social media, writes Evgeny Morozov in an Opinion piece in The New York Times. What went wrong? And should we worry? Read more »

headline.main: Opinion: The Death of the Cyberflâneur
